choices.text: Age of onset of carcinoma in mother
History of carcinoma in any of the family members other than breast

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman has visited surgeons’ office because she is worried that she may develop breast cancer as her mother had breast cancer. The surgeon starts eliciting history, which of the following history is irrelevant to rule out a history of familial carcinoma in her?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

 history of metastasis. Familial carcinomas have multiple carcinomas in family, multifocal and bilateral carcinomas also early age of onset. Metastasis can be seen in either sporadic or familial carcinomas.

choices.text: Increased excretion of drug in the urine

questions.text: A 24-year-old male presents with pharyngitis for last 5 days, the patient was started on oral amoxicillin. 3 days later the patient presents with dark coloured urine. Urine examination now shows haemoglobin & no RBC. which of the following is the mechanism of such manifestation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Type 2 hypersensitivity reaction. So this patient has taken penicillin after which he has presented with hemoglobinuria which suggests there is an intravascular haemolysis. Option C Type 3 hypersensitivity reaction can happen after a post pharyngitis but it will present with hematuria not with hemoglobinuria. Haemoglobinuria suggests intravascular haemolysis. In the above options option B is the only one to cause intravascular haemolysis.

questions.text: Which phase of wound healing involves the formation of granulation tissue?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Proliferative phase includes proliferation of Epithelium, Blood vessel (granulation tissue) and fibroblast

choices.text: Happens in organs where there is rapid pH change
Phosphate ions are sourced from cell membrane

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about dystrophic calcification
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 this is true for metastatic calcification

choices.text: Maternal deletion in a paternally imprinted gene
Paternal deletion in a maternally imprinted gene

questions.text: While studying data of a genetic disease a medical student finds that the disease is occurring both in males and females, Females are transmitting disease to sons and daughters, but males are not transmitting disease to their children, however grandchildren of affected males are having disease. Which of the following inheritance is it likely to be
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Disease is being transmitted from females to children and males to grand children which is characteristic of maternally deleted of paternally imprinted gene.

choices.text: Lactic acid production in absence of oxugen
Increased glucose transporters (GLUT) and Oxidative Phosphorylation
Lactic acid is produced despite presence of oxygen

questions.text: Mechanism of Cancer cells consuming more glucose because
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

tumor cells consume more glucose because they have less efficient glucose metabolism glycolysis ( this happens despite adequate oxygen= Aerobic glycolysis)

choices.text: Both (A) and (R) are independently true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both (A) and (R) are independently true and R is not the correct explanation of A
A is true R is False
R is true A is false
Both A and R are false

questions.text:
Assertion (A): ABO matching is not mandatory for hematopoietic stem cell transplant.
Reason (R): hematopoietic stem cells do not express ABO antigens.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

ABO is not mandatory in BMT because the stem cells don’t express ABO antigens thus won’t be lysed by anti ABO antibodies

questions.text: Which enzyme converts arachidonic acid into leukotrienes, contributing to the late-phase of inflammation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Lipoxygenase (LOX) is the enzyme responsible for converting arachidonic acid into leukotrienes, which play a role in the late-phase of inflammation and immune response.

questions.text: Which of the following cell death is associated with cell membrane damage, normal nuclear morphology and inflammation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Ferroptosis is due to ROS produced from Fe which leads to cell membrane damage, shrunken mitochondria and normal nucleus

choices.text: Better than karyotype to detect unknown mutations

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about Fluorescent insitu hybridization?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

FISH cannot detect Unknown or new mutations as Probes (complementary strand to DNA) is required in FISH.

choices.text: The host response is strong against HPV 6/11 as compared to HPV 16/18
They do not produce oncoproteins required for carcinogenesis
HPV 6/11 Infection doesn’t happen in cervical squamous cells
HPV 6/11 cannot replicate in human cells

questions.text: HPV 6/11 does not cause cervical carcinoma while HPV 16/18 can cause because
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

HPV 6/11 are called low risk HPV as they donot produce Oncoproteins E6 and E7 required for carcinogenesis.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a chemokine?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 IL 1 is chemotaxin not chemo kine. Chemokine are cell specific chemotactic agents IL8 (Neutrophils ) Eotaxin (eosinophils) MCP1 , MIP 1 ( monocytes macrophages)

questions.text: A 16-year-old boy is having episodes of bronchospasm and wheeze after exposure to pollen. The symptoms of wheezing subsided within few hours and after taking salbutamol. Despite taking the drug after 4 days the patient is still having increased cough expectoration and mild dyspnoea. Which of the cell is responsible for current manifestation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 Eosinophil. The patient is having increased expectoration and sputum after 4 or 5 days of an acute episode of bronchospasm this will be a late manifestation of a type I hypersensitivity reaction which are due to eosinophil which secrete eosinophilic cationic protein and major basic proteins which will end up causing tissue destruction, inflammation and increased mucus secretion. On the other hand mast cell occur early, the early phase usually stays for few minutes to few hours after exposure of the antigen which is mediated by histamine which will have bronchospasm and also increased mucus secretion, the late phase typically starts after 1 week and can stay for few days.

questions.text: In which of the following cellular adaptation is there an increased size of organ due to the increase in number of cells?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

hyperplasia are due to increase in cell number which leads to increased organ size and hypertrophy is increased size of organ due to increased cell size.

questions.text: A patient with left sided varicocele is diagnosed of renal cell carcinoma. The manifestation are due to
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

the left testicular vein drains into renal vein. A renal cell carcinoma can compress into renal vein or even spread into renal vein leading to obstruction which causes varicocele.

questions.text:
Which of the following is correct chronological order of steps in performing a karyotype

1) Chromosome release

2) Giemsa staining

3) Addition of phytohemagglutinin

4) Addition of Colchicine

5) Arranging chromosomes in decreasing order
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: A deep skin wound heals mainly by:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Secondary intention

questions.text: A pathologist finds homogenous inclusions in epithelial cells in urine in a 47-year-old who underwent a renal allograft 2 years ago as shown in the figure. Likely diagnosis is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 Intranuclear homogenous inclusions are seen in Polyoma BK virus infection

questions.text: A patient with severe diarrhea has reduced urine output. Kidney biopsy is as follows. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

the image shows vacuolations in tubules which is hydropic change seen in reversible injury

questions.text: Single base primer excision assay is a PCR based test used to detect
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: 5-year-old child with bleeding per rectum and Rectal polyp showing dilated colonic glands with mucin and neutrophils. What is the likely pathology?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Rectum having colonic glands is normal but them being cystically dilated which is due to abnormal organisation that is choristoma.

choices.text: Enzymatic digestion of lipids by T cells

questions.text: A patient presents with fever, weight loss & lymphadenopathy for last 3 months. Biopsy from lymph node is as shown below. Which of the following mechanism represents the finding shown in the image
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

the image shows caseous necrosis, which is due to type IV hypersensitivity, which is cytotoxin mediated cell death.

choices.text: CD 8 T cells from donor killing graft cells
Anti HLA antibodies from donor killing graft cells

Anti ABO antibodies from recipient killing graft cells

questions.text: A 55-year-old underwent 4/6 HLA matched allogenic renal transplant. A few weeks later he has fever, and he has decreased urine output. A renal biopsy shows inflammation in the renal vessels. Which of the following mechanism is most likely to cause such manifestation
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

inflammation of vessels (vasculitis) is seen in humoral rejection

questions.text: Myocardial biopsy of a patient who was being treated for myocardial infarction at a tertiary hospital is as follows. The mechanism for findings marked with arrow is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

 the arrow shows contraction bands in a necrotic myocardium which is seen in reperfusion injury. Although option A is cause of injury but contraction bands are due to increased calcium reaching the tissue.

questions.text: Which of the following diseases follows the pattern of inheritance as given below
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

The given image is mitochondria inheritance

choices.text: Activates T cells by enhancing MHC-TCR interactions
Activates T cells by enhancing CD28 -B71 interactions

questions.text: Ipilimumab is a monoclonal antibody to CTLA-4, what is the likely effect of this drug on cancer cells
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

 CTLA 4 induced by tumor cells binds with B71 and B72 proteins thus not allowing CD28 to interact with B7 proteins (which is needed for T cell activation). Ipilimumab reverses this effect allowing T cell to get activated.

questions.text: Which of the following immunodeficiency disorders occur due to failure of proliferation of lymphoid stem cells in bone marrow?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

SCID occurs due to IL-2 receptor or Adenosine deaminase deficiency leading to non-proliferation of

choices.text: Vasodilation is one of the early events
Margination is the first cellular event of inflammation

questions.text: Which of the following statements is not true about inflammation mechanisms
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

For diapedesis to occur neutrophils have to get activated and release cytokines and enzymes which lead to diapedesis thus Neutrophilic activation Precedes diapedesis

questions.text: A histological examination of a breast lump in a 50-year-old lady shows sheets of pleomorphic cells, high degree of mitosis no gland formation. Imaging shows a 5 cm tumor within the left outer quadrant, multiple axillary lymph nodes and lesions in vertebra. Which of the following is true about this tumor?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

histology shows no gland pleomorphism and mitosis which is high grade, imaging shows lesions in vertebra (metastasis) which is high stage.

questions.text: True about telomere and telomerase is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)
